intro: Orophea anceps, commonly known as the Madagascar star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Orophea anceps is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species in the biodiversity of Madagascar.
